import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 500)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 100)

from itertools import product
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline

from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from xgboost import plot_importance

def plot_features(booster, figsize):    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,1,figsize=figsize)
    return plot_importance(booster=booster, ax=ax)

import time
import sys
import gc
import pickle
sys.version_info

source.70ec103f:
shops.loc[shops.shop_name == 'Сергиев Посад ТЦ "7Я"', 'shop_name'] = 'СергиевПосад ТЦ "7Я"'
# shop nameの先頭文字に規則性があるので、それを空白毎に新しい文字列に分割し配列として保存
shops['city'] = shops['shop_name'].str.split(' ').map(lambda x: x[0])
# 行：!Якутск文字列, 列: cityに'Якутск'を代入
shops.loc[shops.city == '!Якутск', 'city'] = 'Якутск'
# ラベルを0～クラスの種類数n-1の値に変換してくれる。 
#詳細: https://qiita.com/uratatsu/items/8bedbf91e22f90b6e64b
shops['city_code'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(shops['city'])
# shop_idとcity_code列を抽出
shops = shops[['shop_id','city_code']]

cats['split'] = cats['item_category_name'].str.split('-')
cats['type'] = cats['split'].map(lambda x: x[0].strip())
cats['type_code'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(cats['type'])
# if subtype is nan then type
cats['subtype'] = cats['split'].map(lambda x: x[1].strip() if len(x) > 1 else x[0].strip())
cats['subtype_code'] = LabelEncoder().fit_transform(cats['subtype'])
cats = cats[['item_category_id','type_code', 'subtype_code']]

items.drop(['item_name'], axis=1, inplace=True)

source.fa89f1b6:
"""
product:(直積：デカルト積)複数の集合から要素を一つずつ取り出した組み合わせの集合
"""
ts = time.time()
matrix = []
cols = ['date_block_num','shop_id','item_id']
for i in range(34):
    # date_block_numをループで1つずつ抜き出す
    sales = train[train.date_block_num==i]
    # productの第一引数の意味がわからん。-> [i]
    matrix.append(np.array(list(product([i], sales.shop_id.unique(), sales.item_id.unique())), dtype='int16'))
    
# 配列同士の結合で縦方向に結合する
matrix = pd.DataFrame(np.vstack(matrix), columns=cols)
# int8に変換
print(matrix['date_block_num'].dtype)
matrix['date_block_num'] = matrix['date_block_num'].astype(np.int8)
matrix['shop_id'] = matrix['shop_id'].astype(np.int8)
matrix['item_id'] = matrix['item_id'].astype(np.int16)
# colsを基準に昇順でソート
matrix.sort_values(cols,inplace=True)
time.time() - ts
source.8cad4db2:
ts = time.time()
# 3列で集計(groupby)
group = train.groupby(['date_block_num','shop_id','item_id']).agg({'item_cnt_day': ['sum']})
group.columns = ['item_cnt_month']
group.reset_index(inplace=True)
# colsを軸に結合
matrix = pd.merge(matrix, group, on=cols, how='left')
# fillna(0): 欠損値を0で穴埋め、clip(0,20)：0以下は0に置き換えられ、20以上は20に置き換えられる
matrix['item_cnt_month'] = (matrix['item_cnt_month']
                                .fillna(0)
                                .clip(0,20) # NB clip target here
                                .astype(np.float16))
time.time() - ts

source.8d391288:
def lag_feature(df, lags, col):
    tmp = df[['date_block_num','shop_id','item_id',col]]
    for i in lags:
        shifted = tmp.copy()
        shifted.columns = ['date_block_num','shop_id','item_id', col+'_lag_'+str(i)]
        shifted['date_block_num'] += i
        df = pd.merge(df, shifted, on=['date_block_num','shop_id','item_id'], how='left')
    return df

source.95e1f924:
ts = time.time()
# item_idでまとめてitem_price列に平均値を追加。列の追加。インデックスのリセット
group = train.groupby(['item_id']).agg({'item_price': ['mean']})
group.columns = ['item_avg_item_price']
group.reset_index(inplace=True)
# item_idを軸にmatrixとgroupを結合、item_avg_item_priceの型の変換
matrix = pd.merge(matrix, group, on=['item_id'], how='left')
matrix['item_avg_item_price'] = matrix['item_avg_item_price'].astype(np.float16)
#　一番上の処理にdate_block_numを追加してまとめる
group = train.groupby(['date_block_num','item_id']).agg({'item_price': ['mean']})
group.columns = ['date_item_avg_item_price']
group.reset_index(inplace=True)

# 
matrix = pd.merge(matrix, group, on=['date_block_num','item_id'], how='left')
matrix['date_item_avg_item_price'] = matrix['date_item_avg_item_price'].astype(np.float16)

lags = [1,2,3,4,5,6]
matrix = lag_feature(matrix, lags, 'date_item_avg_item_price')

# 割合の算出
for i in lags:
    matrix['delta_price_lag_'+str(i)] = \
        (matrix['date_item_avg_item_price_lag_'+str(i)] - matrix['item_avg_item_price']) / matrix['item_avg_item_price']

def select_trend(row):
    for i in lags:
        if row['delta_price_lag_'+str(i)]:
            return row['delta_price_lag_'+str(i)]
    return 0
    
matrix['delta_price_lag'] = matrix.apply(select_trend, axis=1)
matrix['delta_price_lag'] = matrix['delta_price_lag'].astype(np.float16)
matrix['delta_price_lag'].fillna(0, inplace=True)

# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31828240/first-non-null-value-per-row-from-a-list-of-pandas-columns/31828559
# matrix['price_trend'] = matrix[['delta_price_lag_1','delta_price_lag_2','delta_price_lag_3']].bfill(axis=1).iloc[:, 0]
# Invalid dtype for backfill_2d [float16]

fetures_to_drop = ['item_avg_item_price', 'date_item_avg_item_price']
for i in lags:
    fetures_to_drop += ['date_item_avg_item_price_lag_'+str(i)]
    fetures_to_drop += ['delta_price_lag_'+str(i)]

matrix.drop(fetures_to_drop, axis=1, inplace=True)

time.time() - ts
source.7fa706f6:
ts = time.time()
group = train.groupby(['date_block_num','shop_id']).agg({'revenue': ['sum']})
group.columns = ['date_shop_revenue']
group.reset_index(inplace=True)

matrix = pd.merge(matrix, group, on=['date_block_num','shop_id'], how='left')
matrix['date_shop_revenue'] = matrix['date_shop_revenue'].astype(np.float32)

group = group.groupby(['shop_id']).agg({'date_shop_revenue': ['mean']})
group.columns = ['shop_avg_revenue']
group.reset_index(inplace=True)

matrix = pd.merge(matrix, group, on=['shop_id'], how='left')
matrix['shop_avg_revenue'] = matrix['shop_avg_revenue'].astype(np.float32)

matrix['delta_revenue'] = (matrix['date_shop_revenue'] - matrix['shop_avg_revenue']) / matrix['shop_avg_revenue']
matrix['delta_revenue'] = matrix['delta_revenue'].astype(np.float16)

matrix = lag_feature(matrix, [1], 'delta_revenue')

matrix.drop(['date_shop_revenue','shop_avg_revenue','delta_revenue'], axis=1, inplace=True)
time.time() - ts
source.1b3d3849:
ts = time.time()
cache = {}
matrix['item_shop_last_sale'] = -1
matrix['item_shop_last_sale'] = matrix['item_shop_last_sale'].astype(np.int8)
# iterrows()で一行ずつ抜き出し、keyにはitem_id shop_idの文字列を代入
"""
各ショップ/アイテムペアおよびアイテムのみの最後の販売からの月数
"""
for idx, row in matrix.iterrows():    
    key = str(row.item_id)+' '+str(row.shop_id)
    if key not in cache:
        if row.item_cnt_month!=0:
            cache[key] = row.date_block_num
    else:
        last_date_block_num = cache[key]
        matrix.at[idx, 'item_shop_last_sale'] = row.date_block_num - last_date_block_num
        cache[key] = row.date_block_num         
time.time() - ts

source.64a7fb9f:
X_train = data[data.date_block_num < 33].drop(['item_cnt_month'], axis=1)
Y_train = data[data.date_block_num < 33]['item_cnt_month']
X_valid = data[data.date_block_num == 33].drop(['item_cnt_month'], axis=1)
Y_valid = data[data.date_block_num == 33]['item_cnt_month']
X_test = data[data.date_block_num == 34].drop(['item_cnt_month'], axis=1)
source.92a5e882:
ts = time.time()

model = XGBRegressor(
    max_depth=8,
    n_estimators=1000,
    min_child_weight=300, 
    colsample_bytree=0.8, 
    subsample=0.8, 
    eta=0.3,    
    seed=42)

model.fit(
    X_train, 
    Y_train, 
    eval_metric="rmse", 
    eval_set=[(X_train, Y_train), (X_valid, Y_valid)], 
    verbose=True, 
    early_stopping_rounds = 10)

time.time() - ts
source.babe6239:
Y_pred = model.predict(X_valid).clip(0, 20)
Y_test = model.predict(X_test).clip(0, 20)

submission = pd.DataFrame({
    "ID": test.index, 
    "item_cnt_month": Y_test
})
submission.to_csv('xgb_submission.csv', index=False)

# save predictions for an ensemble
pickle.dump(Y_pred, open('xgb_train.pickle', 'wb'))
pickle.dump(Y_test, open('xgb_test.pickle', 'wb'))
source.a7c57ed9: Number of days in a month. There are no leap years.
source.97dc7f69: There is one item with price below zero. Fill it with median.
source.054d01b8: There are items with strange prices and sales. After detailed exploration I decided to remove items with price > 100000 and sales > 1001 (1000 is ok).
source.00b3ff53: Producing lags brings a lot of nulls.
source.76ac0df6: Months since the last sale for each shop/item pair and for item only. I use programing approach. Create HashTable with key equals to {shop_id,item_id} and value equals to date_block_num. Iterate data from the top. Foreach row if {row.shop_id,row.item_id} is not present in the table, then add it to the table and set its value to row.date_block_num. if HashTable contains key, then calculate the difference beteween cached value and row.date_block_num.
source.e3ca7df6: Aggregate train set by shop/item pairs to calculate target aggreagates, then clip(0,20) target value. This way train target will be similar to the test predictions. I use floats instead of ints for item_cnt_month to avoid downcasting it after concatination with the test set later. If it would be int16, after concatination with NaN values it becomes int64, but foat16 becomes float16 even with NaNs.
source.c2196981:
## Test set
To use time tricks append test pairs to the matrix.
source.527cba7a: Months since the first sale for each shop/item pair and for item only.
source.1493681a:
## Shops/Cats/Items preprocessing
Observations:
* Each shop_name starts with the city name.
* Each category contains type and subtype in its name.
source.1e6cd1c4: Several shops are duplicates of each other (according to its name). Fix train and test set.
source.33ddf43d:
This notebook is simpified version of the final project in the [How to Win a Data Science Competition: Learn from Top Kagglers](https://www.coursera.org/learn/competitive-data-science) course. Simplified means without ensembling.

#### Pipline
* load data
* heal data and remove outliers
* work with shops/items/cats objects and features
* create matrix as product of item/shop pairs within each month in the train set
* get monthly sales for each item/shop pair in the train set and merge it to the matrix
* clip item_cnt_month by (0,20)
* append test to the matrix, fill 34 month nans with zeros
* merge shops/items/cats to the matrix
* add target lag features
* add mean encoded features
* add price trend features
* add month
* add days
* add months since last sale/months since first sale features
* cut first year and drop columns which can not be calculated for the test set
* select best features
* set validation strategy 34 test, 33 validation, less than 33 train
* fit the model, predict and clip targets for the test set
source.48f0ab79: ## Monthly sales Test set is a product of some shops and some items within 34 month. There are 5100 items * 42 shops = 214200 pairs. 363 items are new compared to the train. Hence, for the most of the items in the test set target value should be zero. In the other hand train set contains only pairs which were sold or returned in the past. Tha main idea is to calculate monthly sales and extend it with zero sales for each unique pair within the month. This way train data will be similar to test data.
source.14c8dd54: Validation strategy is 34 month for the test set, 33 month for the validation set and 13-33 months for the train.
source.19982852:
## Final preparations
Because of the using 12 as lag value drop first 12 months. Also drop all the columns with this month calculated values (other words which can not be calcucated for the test set).
